question.body: Which structure separates the oropharynx and the nasopharynx?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The labia are the lips that surround the opening to the mouth.
Incorrect. The hard palate creates the bony wall between the oral and nasal cavities.
Correct. The soft palate is an arch shaped muscular structure that divides the oropharynx and nasopharynx.
Incorrect. The lingual tonsils are located at the base of the tongue and have immune function.
